Key Match Events: Mahmoud Hassan ‘Trezeguet’ gave the hosts the lead after 33 minutes.
Mohamed Salah sealed the victory with a second-half penalty, capitalising on a foul on Omar Marmoush in the box.
Post-Match Reflections: Mbwana Samatta said that playing against one of the African giants was a valuable experience and the perfect build-up before facing Morocco on January 17.
Samatta shared the lessons learned from facing Egypt, stating that playing against them has helped the team pick up some lessons to work on going into the Afcon.
Taifa Stars head coach Adel Amrouche echoed Samatta’s sentiments, saying that the team has prepared well in Egypt and is heading to the Afcon not just to participate but to compete.
Amrouche declared that there is no easy game in the competition, and the team needs to fight in all matches.
